page.title: 09MORESBY-KEEKLE OPENCAST 2.
page.content: Certain skills are needed to work at an opencast site as many complex types of machinery are used . One of the largest machines in use is a 195B digger which has a shovel capacity of 17 square yards or 12 tons.This machine is worked by high voltage electricity which is very dangerous, so the cable has to be strung along the top of high poles. The largest machine has just been commisioned and will work on the project until 1988.The RH 120C is a 200 ton hydraulic excavator.Each scoop of the bucket clears 35 tons of earth. The excavator,built in Germany, cost Â£1.5 million and took fitters on the site two months to assemble.A third crane had to be brought in to fit the cabin onto the tracks. Roughly 800_1,000 tons of coal are mined each day.
